intro: Diplotaxis viminea var. confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy, linear leaves. It produces clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. The species is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability.
